records.general_info:
“Kampai: For The Love Of Sake” is a film that documents the efforts by a British sake brewer, an American journalist and a young president of a century-old sake brewery in Japan to explore the world of sake and the challenges that the industry faces. 

The film is rated “PG” mainly due to the focus on appreciation of an alcoholic beverage.
records.title: "KAMPAI: FOR THE LOVE OF SAKE

records.general_info:
“#66” is an Indonesian action film about a hired killer who wants to turn over a new leaf, but gets embroiled in the dealings of a criminal organisation for the sake of protecting his family.  

The film is rated M18 with consumer advice of “Violence”.

The film contains some violent sequences involving the use of weapons such as guns and knives, with bloodletting seen. In one sequence, a man enters a drug den and begins shooting some men in the head. Blood spurts are seen as the men get shot. There is also a prolonged sequence where the protagonist is seen fending off several men by shooting them or stabbing them. One of the stronger depictions shows the protagonist stabbing a man repeatedly in the stomach before slitting the latter’s neck, with blood spurts shown.  Under the M18 Classification Guidelines,   “realistic depiction of violence and gore with strong impact is allowed if justified by context.”

records.producer: CHRIS MELEDANDRI, JANET HEALY, BRETT HOFFMAN, KYLE BALDA
records.title: 10 MINION MINI-MOVIES
records.director: ERIC FAVELA, REGIS SCHULLER, DIDIER AH-KOON, KYLE BALDA
